paragraphs.title: STEP I: Register the dataset using below Oracle access options
paragraphs.text:
%snappydata
{
val datasetName = z.input("Enter Name for the Dataset:", "AirlineRef").asInstanceOf[String]
val url = z.input("Enter JDBC URL for Oracle:", "jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:xe")
//val database = z.input("Enter Database Name:", "").asInstanceOf[String]
val oracleTable = z.input("Enter Table Name:", "AirlineDataWithRowID")
val user = z.input("Enter User:", "system")
val password = z.input("Enter Password:", "oracle")
z.put("oracleTable", oracleTable)
z.put("datasetName", datasetName)
z.put("url",url)
z.put("user" ,user)
z.put("password",password)

var connectionString =s"create external table $datasetName using JDBC options (url '$url', dbtable '$oracleTable', user '$user', password '$password', driver 'oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver'"
z.put("connectionString",connectionString)
}

paragraphs.title: STEP IV: Cache the data in SnappyData Column/Row table
paragraphs.text:
%snappydata
{
import org.apache.spark.sql.SnappySession

val ss = new SnappySession(snc.sparkContext)

val datasetName = z.get("datasetName")
val tabName = datasetName+ "_cache"

val tableType = z.select("SnappyData Table type", Seq(("column" ,"Column"),
                                                    ("row","row"))).asInstanceOf[String]
ss.sql(s"drop table if exists $tabName")
ss.sql(s"create table $tabName using $tableType as select * from $datasetName" )

println(s"Created table named $tabName")
println("With row count = " + ss.table(s"$tabName").count )
}
